titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Isadore Freed collection ARCH172
titlestmt.author: Original finding aid by Ethel Bacon and Margaret Mair. Revised by Sean Parke, Oct. 2017.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-04-23 14:30:59 -0400.

change.item: Finding aid revised and updated following reprocessing in 2017.
Revised to include OV compositions found on shelf (found labelled as part of the collection, but it was not included in original finding aid).

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.abstract: This small collection contains photographs, newspaper clippings, press releases, compositions, and concert programs pertaining to Isadore Freed at the Julius Hartt School of Music and the Hartt College of Music.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: All of the photographs in the collection have been digitized and can be accessed at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu. Public access to the digital repository is limited to the University of Hartford Campus. Computers are available to the public at the Harrison Libraries. Off-campus access is available for University of Hartford students, faculty, and staff with their university email and password.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Isadore Freed (1900-1960) an internationally known composer who joined the Hartt faculty in 1944. He chaired the department of composition and theory. He achieved special notice as a composer of Jewish liturgical music and was considered a leading organist. He was born in Brest-litovsk, Russia and came to the U. S. as a young boy. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and also studied abroad.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Isadore Freed collection consists of photographs, newspaper clippings, press releases, compositions, and concert programs pertaining to Isadore Freed at the Julius Hartt School of Music and the Hartt College of Music. The collection also includes short bios, resumes, and completed questionnaires which provide background information on Freed's career.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains scores or sheet music for:
Freed, Isadore. The Princess and the Vagabond, Circa 1950.
Freed, Isadore. The Prophecy of Micah: Oratorio. New York: Hebrew Union College - Jewish Institute of Religion, undated.
Freed, Isadore. A Festive Psalm: Psalm 30. New York: Transcontinental Music Publication, 1956.
Freed, Isadore. Psalm VIII. New York: Southern Music Publishing, undated.
Freed, Isadore. Jerusalem Redeemed. New York: Independent Music Publishers, undated.
Marked up pieces and score of: Freed, Isadore. Triptych for Violin, Viola, Cello, and Piano. New York: Independent Music Publishers, undated.
